Events that occurred on 11 September.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1918 - J.R.R. Tolkien is transferred to Savoy Convalescent Hospital, Blackpool, west coast of England.
1951 - Second day of the Congrès Internationale de Philologie Moderne at the University of Liège, a conference in which J.R.R. Tolkien delivers the paper "Middle English 'Losenger'".
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 169.
1957 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 202.
1957 - The Oxford Mail reports from the International Fantasy Award, won by Tolkien.
1959 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 217.
1964 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 264.
1967 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 298.
1970 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 316.
1982 - The ninth episode of the new version of the 1981 radio series of The Lord of the Rings is aired on BBC Radio 4.
2006 - Translator William Auld dies.
2010 - Bulgarian Tolkien Society's 6th Tolkien-Fest in Sofia.
2014 - Oxonmoot 2014 at Lady Margaret Hall.
2015 - Oxonmoot 2015 at St Antony's College.
2016 - Oxonmoot 2016 at St Antony's College.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
T.A. 3018:
Gandalf is held captive by Saruman on the pinnacle of Orthanc.
Boromir travels towards Rivendell to ask for counsel.
Full moon[1]

content.content: ↑ Wayne G. Hammond and Christina Scull (eds), The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion, p. xlviii
